qas.question: In addition to a license to sell spirits, what did tavern owners require a license to sell?
In what century did public drinking regulations first exist in England?
What party received income from the sale of public drinking house licenses?

context: There was already regulation on public drinking spaces in the <a1_0>17th<a1_0/> and 18th centuries,[citation needed] and the income earned from licences was beneficial to <a2_0>the crown<a2_0/>. Tavern owners were required to possess a licence to sell <a0_0>ale<a0_0/>, and a separate licence for distilled spirits.
